name: Dr. Prof Sourav Das
description: The IEEE-Industry Applications Society (IAS) Student Branch Chapter (SBC), Code: IA14301D, was established in 2024 at the Institute of Engineering and Management (IEM), Kolkata. Since its inception, the chapter has been actively fostering industry-academia collaboration and technical excellence. It currently operates under the dynamic leadership of Prof. Dr. Sourav Das from the Department of Electrical Engineering, IEM Kolkata, guiding students towards innovation and professional growth in industrial applications of electrical and electronic engineering.

name: Sneha Das
description: Oversees the planning and execution of student-driven technical initiatives, promotes industry-oriented learning, and facilitates collaboration within the chapter to advance innovation in industrial applications of electrical and electronic engineering.

name: Avi Kundu
description: Supports the leadership team in organizing technical events, coordinating member activities, and promoting interdisciplinary engagement to enhance student involvement in industrial applications of electrical and electronic engineering.

name: Debosmita Gorai
description: Supports the leadership team by managing communications, maintaining official records, and coordinating meetings and events. Plays a key role in organizing technical activities, engaging members, and fostering interdisciplinary collaboration to enhance student participation in the field of industrial electronics, including automation, power electronics, and embedded systems.

name: Arka Goswami
description: Responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the chapter’s digital presence. Manages the official website, updates content related to events, achievements, and announcements, and ensures seamless online engagement. Supports the chapter’s mission by enhancing visibility, promoting technical activities, and enabling effective communication through digital platforms.

name: Asmit Sil
description: Manages financial planning and budgeting for chapter activities, ensures transparent allocation of resources, and supports the execution of technical initiatives aligned with the chapter’s objectives in industrial applications of electrical and electronic engineering.
